research_results.title: 31 Top-Rated Tourist Attractions in Paris | PlanetWare
research_results.content:
Throughout the year, events to honor national holidays are held at the Arc de Triomphe, including the November 11th (anniversary of the Armistice of 1918) ceremony commemorating those who perished in the war; the May 8th Fête de la Victoire (Victory Day) celebrating the end of WWII, and the liberation from Nazi occupation; as well as festivities for July 14th (Bastille Day).
 Other masterpieces of the Louvre include the ancient Vénus de Milo sculpture; the monumental Victoire de Samothrace of the Hellenistic period; the immense Wedding Feast at Cana painting by Veronese (1563); Sandro Botticelli's Venus and the Three Graces fresco; and Liberty Leading the People (1831) by Eugène Delacroix, depicting the Parisian uprising of July 1830.
 From the top of the monument, a viewing terrace affords a panoramic outlook onto the 12 avenues that radiate from the Place de l'Étoile, including the route from the Avenue des Champs-Elysées to the Place de la Concorde and the Louvre. Artistic treasures are found throughout the gardens, such as the picturesque 17th-century Fontaine Médicis, a fountain basin nestled under trees opposite the east front of the Palais du Luxembourg, which today is used by the French state as the seat of the Senate.
 Currently, the interior of the cathedral (including the towers) and the space immediately in front of the cathedral (on the Parvis Notre-Dame) are closed to the public.

research_results.title: 32 Best Things to Do in Paris, France | U.S. News Travel
research_results.content: The Montparnasse Tower Observation Deck claims to have the best views in Paris - and once you reach the top, it's easy to see why. The lower deck stands more than 650 feet high and overlooks ...

research_results.title: 48 Best Things to Do in Paris | Condé Nast Traveler
research_results.content:
Standing proudly between the Louvre and Place de la Concorde, and along much of the Seine's Right Bank in the 1st Arrondissement, Tuileries Garden ("Jardin des Tuileries") has a history as long and distinguished as it is impressive, from its inception as an aristocratic playground in the 16th century, to becoming a public space in the 17th century, to serving as the site of numerous French Revolution skirmishes in the 18th century. The interior—red booths, mahogany, polished brass railings—has changed little since the Art Deco period, but anyone who is anyone knows that the best seats in the house are actually out on the sidewalk (and thankfully the famous terrasse is open at full capacity again), where the people watching can't be beat and the city's café iconic culture is at its finest. Located within the Cité de la Musique complex in the Parc de la Villette, in the underexplored 19th arrondissement, the building breaks with all the design conventions of traditional symphony halls, instead favoring pod-like boxes inside the theater, a stage in the round, and a complex, undulating metal façade.
 The layout of the building has been redesigned, highlighting the beauty of the mid-16th century mansions as much as helping you to discover the paleolithic origins of the city through the present with 3,800 works now on display. Lauren Dana Ellman
David Annand
Nicola Chilton
Susan B. Barnes
Musée d'OrsayArrow
A vast collection of Impressionist art is the focus at the Musée d’Orsay, the second-most-visited museum in Paris (after the Louvre, of course).

research_results.title: Paris in One Week: The Perfect 7 Day Itinerary for 2023 - Travel Passionate
research_results.content: How to spend 7 days in Paris, a comprehensive itinerary. Day 1: Montparnasse Tower. Day 2: Saint Chapelle, Notre Dame, Pont Neuf, Les Marais. Day 3: Louvre Museum, Orsay Museum, Place de la Concorde, Champs-Elysees, Arc de Triomphe. Day 4: Palais Royal, Place Vendome.

research_results.title: The ultimate 7-day Paris itinerary - Tripadvisor
research_results.content: This 7-day Paris itinerary combines all that, covering one Parisian district at a time. Since Paris is a walkable city, this itinerary is designed for explorations on foot. However, the Paris metro and buses will come in handy for covering long distances. Get a Navigo weekly ticket for unlimited rides on the transport network in Paris.

research_results.title: The Ultimate 7-Day Paris Itinerary [For Your First Trip]
research_results.content: Notre-Dame De Paris. In Paris in 7 days, this Cathedral, famous for its rich and varied history and for its prominence in the life of the city, is located on the Ile de la Cité in the 4th arrondissement. It is an emblem of Paris, a dream for lovers of Gothic architecture, and a must for tourists in the city.

research_results.title: 11 Best Affordable Hotels in Paris - Travel + Leisure
research_results.content:
Key Specs
Notable Amenities
Restaurant and bar, live concerts, spa cabins with hot tubs and sensory showers
Hotel Description
Chouchou opened in the fall of 2020, and it quickly cemented itself as one of the coolest hangout spots in the Ninth Arrondissement. A French-style buffet breakfast is served every morning (children under 10 eat free), while complimentary madeleines, tea, coffee, and hot chocolate are served in the winter garden each day from 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.
Hôtel Saint-Marc
Why We Chose It
With a stellar location and luxe amenities, Hôtel Saint-Marc feels far more expensive than it actually is.
 Key Specs
Notable Amenities
Free coffee and tea in every room, minibars with complimentary soft drinks, laundry service
Hotel Description
This four-star hotel is just a quick walk from the Louvre and Jardin du Palais-Royal, but it has plenty of amenities that will make you want to linger before venturing out. Key Specs
Notable Amenities
Honesty bar, hammam and massage room, complimentary afternoon tea
Hotel Description
This boutique four-star hotel is located in the heart of the Latin Quarter, a quaint Fifth Arrondissement neighborhood filled with bookstores and cafes. Key Specs
Notable Amenities
Rooftop sauna and hot tub, Nespresso machines, fitness center
Hotel Description
This building in the 15th Arrondissement was once home to a rather unremarkable budget hotel, but it received a cool, retro makeover and reopened as Hôtel Wallace in late 2021.

research_results.title: 16 Best Free Museums In Paris Worth A Visit - Roaming Paris
research_results.content: 1. Maison De Victor Hugo (Victor Hugo's House) Victor Hugo's House is one of the best free museums in Paris worth a visit- Pack-Shot/ Shutterstock. While better known for his literary work Les Miserables and the Hunchback of Notre Dame, Victor Hugo's biography extends to poetry, playwright, statesman, congressman, and human rights activist.

research_results.title: 16 Best Free Museums in Paris Worth Visiting
research_results.content: Opening Hours: Tuesday - Sunday (10:00 a.m. - 5:30 p.m.) 4. Musée Bourdelle, 15th Arrondissement. Musée Bourdelle is one of the best free museums in Paris. Located in the previous home and studio of French sculpture Antoine Bourdelle, Musée Bourdelle is dedicated to showcasing Bourdelle's work and life story.

research_results.title: Free museums in Paris: All 35 museums to visit (July 2024)
research_results.content: The Zadkine Museum (Musée Zadkine) is a small museum in Paris with works by Ossip Zadkine (1890-1967), a Russian-born artist who lived in France. The museum is located in the house and studio where he lived and worked from 1928 until his death. There are around 400 sculptures, gouaches, works on pap. 4.0.

research_results.title: Parking In Paris Guide: Where To Park, Cost, and Tips
research_results.content: Tariffs differ from areas. In central Paris and busy tourist spots, one needs to allow 2.50 euros for an hour, 5 euros for 2 hours and about 20 euros for 12 to 4 hours. On the outskirts of the city, prices are often lower, and you might pay on average from 10 euros to 15 euros for 24 hours. For the weekend or by the week or month, underground ...

recommendations.title: Visit the Louvre Museum
recommendations.description: Explore one of the world's largest art museums, home to masterpieces like the Mona Lisa and the Venus de Milo.
recommendations.reasoning: Your interest in museums perfectly aligns with a visit to the Louvre, which offers rich historical and artistic experiences.

recommendations.title: Relax at Jardin des Tuileries
recommendations.description: Walk through the historic Tuileries Garden, located between the Louvre and Place de la Concorde, and enjoy its beautiful landscaping and statues.
recommendations.reasoning: As an admirer of parks, the Tuileries Garden offers you a serene environment for relaxation between your museum visits.

recommendations.title: Cheap Shopping at Chinemachine
recommendations.description: Find hidden gems in this vintage and thrift shop located in Montmartre, offering affordable unique clothing and accessories.
recommendations.reasoning: Chinemachine is perfect for budget-friendly shopping and aligns with your interest in finding unique, affordable items.

recommendations.title: Explore Musée d'Orsay
recommendations.description: Discover a vast collection of Impressionist and post-Impressionist masterpieces in a stunning former railway station.
recommendations.reasoning: Your interest in museums makes Musée d'Orsay a must-visit destination, enriching your cultural knowledge.

recommendations.title: Stroll in Parc des Buttes-Chaumont
recommendations.description: Enjoy scenic views, waterfalls, and bridges in one of Paris's most picturesque parks, perfect for a relaxing day out.
recommendations.reasoning: Parc des Buttes-Chaumont is an ideal choice for a nature walk and quiet reflection, fitting your park interests well.

recommendations.title: Visit Arc de Triomphe
recommendations.description: Experience sweeping views of Paris from the top of this iconic monument, which stands at the western end of the Champs-Élysées.
recommendations.reasoning: The Arc de Triomphe not only offers historical insights but also provides a central point for exploring Parisian landmarks.

recommendations.title: Browse Affordable Items at Emmaüs Boutique Solidaire
recommendations.description: Shop at this community-driven store for second-hand clothing, furniture, and more at excellent prices.
recommendations.reasoning: Given your interest in shopping on a budget, Emmaüs offers a wide variety of affordable and unique finds.

recommendations.title: Take In Views from Montparnasse Tower
recommendations.description: Admire panoramic views of Paris from the Montparnasse Tower's observation deck, purported to have the best views of the city.
recommendations.reasoning: This activity is a cost-effective way to get a stunning overview of the city, without the crowds often found at the Eiffel Tower.

recommendations.title: Relax at Jardin du Luxembourg
recommendations.description: Enjoy the tranquil beauty of the Luxembourg Gardens with its well-kept lawns, flowerbeds, and historic fountains.
recommendations.reasoning: As a lover of parks, Jardin du Luxembourg provides an idyllic setting for relaxation and reflection during your trip.

recommendations.title: Explore Free Museums like Victor Hugo's House
recommendations.description: Visit Maison de Victor Hugo, a free museum showcasing the life and works of the famous author of 'Les Misérables' and 'The Hunchback of Notre Dame.'
recommendations.reasoning: Exploring free museums will allow you to delve into Paris's cultural history without straining your budget.

recommendations.title: Picnic at Champ de Mars Park
recommendations.description: Have a relaxing picnic with stunning views of the Eiffel Tower at this expansive public greenspace.
recommendations.reasoning: Champ de Mars Park offers a perfect combination of iconic views and relaxing natural scenery, ideal for a budget-friendly yet memorable outing.

recommendations.title: Visit Musée Bourdelle
recommendations.description: Discover the works and life story of French sculptor Antoine Bourdelle in this free museum located in his former home and studio.
recommendations.reasoning: This free museum aligns with your interests and budget constraints, providing a unique cultural experience.
